meanings.definition: Trapeziuses: the large muscles extending from the base of the skull to the middle of the back and shoulder
meanings.sent1: During exercise, it is important to strengthen your trapeziuses to support your neck and shoulders.
meanings.sent2: Athletes often focus on developing their trapeziuses to improve their posture and prevent injuries.
meanings.sent3: The trapeziuses were so sore after the workout that even lifting a pencil felt like a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her trapeziuses were like sturdy pillars holding up her head high with confidence.
meanings.sent5: The trapeziuses, like two strong bands, connected her upper body seamlessly.

meanings.definition: Trapeziuses: plural form of trapezius, referring to the pair of muscles in the upper back and neck area.
meanings.sent1: The trapeziuses play a crucial role in allowing us to move our shoulders and neck freely.
meanings.sent2: When carrying heavy bags, you can feel the strain on your trapeziuses as they work to support the weight.
meanings.sent3: At the gym, he joked that his trapeziuses were the real MVPs for helping him lift weights.
meanings.sent4: Her trapeziuses were like twin guardians protecting her upper body from harm.
meanings.sent5: The trapeziuses, like diligent workers, never complain as they tirelessly support our movements.
